summary: AST SpaceMobile Inc. is helping shape the future of global internet connectivity through its ambitious satellite-based technology . The market for satellite internet is projected to grow rapidly, with analysts estimating it could reach $24.6 billion by 2030 . ASTS stock is following this trend, recording a surging 14% gain over the past week .  AST SpaceMobile’s direct-to-smartphone approach requires no special hardware or apps . The company plans to launch five satellites over the next six to nine months . This technology could unlock massive markets, particularly in developing countries .  AST SpaceMobile is still in its early stages, burning through cash as it builds its satellite network . The company reported revenue of just $718,000 for Q1 2025, falling well short of the $4 million that analysts expected . With $874 million in cash on hand, ASTS has manageable debt levels .  AST SpaceMobile is ambitiously pushing the boundaries of satellite communications . Management is projecting dramatic revenue growth with aprojected second-half 2025 revenue of $50 million to $75 million .  ASTS has recently won several government contracts, including a $43 million deal with the U.S. Space Development Agency . Members of the Blue Origin management team visited the AST headquarters in Texas recently, sparking speculation of a potential partnership with Amazon . The path to building a satellite network comes with a hefty price tag .  TipRanks rates AST SpaceMobile as aStrong Buy, based on the consensus of five analyst recommendations . The stock carries an average price target of $38.60, suggesting a potential upside of 24% over the next 12 months .  AST SpaceMobile is at the forefront of next-generation global connectivity . The market opportunity is significant, and the underlying technology holds considerable promise . The company faces a range of challenges, including technical hurdles, funding requirements, regulatory complexities, and intense competition .

Snowflake’s SNOW data warehouse platform has been gaining traction as enterprises increasingly rely on scalable, cloud native infrastructure to unify, analyze and share large volumes of data . Snowflake recently launched Standard Warehouse – Generation 2 (Gen2) delivers up to 2.1X faster analytics performance and 1.9X faster execution .  SNOW’s innovative portfolio is driving clientele. In the first quarter of fiscal 2026, Snowflake added 451 new customers, bringing the total to 11,578 (up 19% year over year) Snowflake maintained a net revenue retention rate of 124%.  Microsoft’s tightly integrated stack and expanding AI capabilities are positioning it as a formidable player in next-gen data infrastructure . Snowflake shares have appreciated 36.5% year to date, outperforming the broader Zacks Computer & Technology sector .  Snowflake stock is trading at a premium, with a forward 12-month Price/Sales of 14.48X compared with the industry’s 5.69X . The Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter fiscal 2026 earnings is pegged at 26 cents per share . SNOW currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold)  Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) and Snowflake Inc. (SNOW) have all been outperforming in recent years . Snowflake is one of the leading companies in the U.S. market .

Digital sales were a bright spot in an otherwise soft first-quarter fiscal 2025, marked by sluggish traffic and a decline in comparable store sales . Digitally originated comparable sales rose 4.7% year over year .  Target reported a nearly 20% year-over-year improvement in delivery speed, enhancing convenience at a time when consumers are looking for value and fast delivery . Like Target, Walmart is leaning heavily into same-day delivery to drive digital growth .  Target stock has declined 13.7% over the past three months against the industry’s growth of 8.6% . Target currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) Target carries a Value Score of B .  Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) has been ranked #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here . Target Corporation (TGT) and Walmart Inc. have been in the market for more than two years .

United Natural Foods posts better-than-expected fiscal third-quarter profit and sales . The company now sees a full-year net loss of $55 million to $80 million . The food distribution company is a key supplier to Amazon's Whole Foods Markets .  United Natural Foods posted fiscal third-quarter adjustedearnings per share (EPS) of $0.44, double what analysts were looking for . Net sales increased 7.5% year-over-year to $8.06 billion, also ahead of estimates . CEO Sandy Douglas says company is "focused on diligently managing through the process"  United Natural Foods is a major supplier of Amazon's (AMZN) Whole Foods Markets . Yesterday’s news sent shares into negative territory for the year . With today's 4% slide they are down about 9% in 2025 .

Amazon Key Access Control System provides secure, convenient, affordable building access for residents, staff, visitors, and delivery drivers . Amazon Key streamlines deliveries and building access, giving customers control over who can enter their property .  Amazon Key addresses pain points of traditional building intercoms by adding features like online access management, remote control via smartphone and virtual keys . The Amazon Key Access Control System includes four different solutions . Each solution is professionally installed to allow for quick, easy entry into the building .  Virtual Key is a simple upgrade to a property’s existing intercom that allows residents to gain self-entry or grant visitors access through the Ring app . Intercom Boost is a small tag that you can add to an existing call box that enables visitors to view a resident directory and initiate one-way video and two-way audio calls with residents via smartphone .  Amazon Key Access Control System allows visitors to browse the resident directory or enter building access codes directly on the screen . Charney Property Management chose the system because it offered an affordable, modern replacement for aging intercoms .  Amazon Key empowers customers to easily manage access to their homes and businesses . The Amazon Key Access Control System Virtual Key and Intercom Lite are available for order today . Amazon Key has been solving access and delivery challenges since 2017 .  Amazon Key unlocks doors more than 4 times per second across 10 countries, empowering customers to easily manage access to their homes and businesses . Amazon Key products currently serve single-family homes, multi-family properties, and commercial businesses across four continents .
Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet's Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Amazon.com (AMZN), and Meta Platforms (META) amo.com .

Amazon plans to invest at least $20 billion in Pennsylvania . The two data centers will be located in Falls Township in Bucks County, and Salem Township in Luzerne County . The investment will support thousands of construction jobs and other positions in the data center supply chain .  Amazon also plans to establish a pipeline of training programs that will help Pennsylvania workers build future data centers . Gov. Shapiro: "This initial investment from Amazon will create thousands of good-paying, stable jobs"  Amazon’s investment comes amid a turbulent construction climate, wheredata centers remain king . Google has invested more than $17 billion in servers and data centers this year .  The venture of Oracle, Softbank and OpenAI committed to investing at least $100 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure . It could scale up to $500 billion .

IBM is building the first large-scale quantum computer capable of operating without errors . The computer, called Starling, is set to launch by 2029 . IBM stock hit an all-time high of $273.27 on Monday, more than the S&P 500's roughly 12% gain .  IBM’s Starling is a “significant” development for the quantum computing market, IDC quantum analyst Heather West said . Once developed, useful quantum computers would solve problems that would take “classical” computers billions of years .  IBM says Starling will be able to run large-scale quantum operations without error . Unlike traditional computers that use bits or series of 1s and 0s, quantum machines use qubits . Qubits are a function of quantum mechanics and, rather than being expressed as a 1 or 0, can exist as both at the same time, allowing for far more processing capabilities .  IBM will use a code called qLDPC requiring its quantum computers to use fewer qubits . The company says this will allow it to scale the computers without making them less accurate . Google also said it achieved this feat with its Willow chip in late 2024 .  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said in January that useful quantum computing was decades away . Horvath expects “useful’s quantum computers will arrive within the next five years . Tech CEOs have previously projected longer timelines .

Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway has nearly 23% of its portfolio invested in two artificial intelligence stocks, Apple and Amazon . Amazon is deploying AI tools and products across its retail and cloud computing businesses . Morgan Stanley views the company as an underappreciated leader .  Apple aims to monetize its installed base exceeding 2.35 billion devices with add-on services like iCloud storage, Apple Care, Apple Pay, and App Store content . Many analysts expect Apple to eventually monetize artificial intelligence .  Siri upgrades have been delayed for months despite many pundits predicting a massive upgrade cycle . Last month, Apple announced plans to open its Apple Intelligence large language models to third-party developers .  The investment thesis for Amazon centers on its strong position in three industries . Wall Street has downwardly revised estimates due to totariff uncertainty . Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the largest public cloud in terms of infrastructure and platform services revenue .  Morgan Stanley recently called Amazon's retail business the "most underappreciated" generative AI beneficiary in the technology space . The company has developed custom semiconductors for AI training and inference that offer better price performance than the leading graphics processing units .  Wall Street estimates Amazon's earnings will increase at 10% annually through 2026 . Amazon beat the consensus estimate by an average of 21% over the last six quarters . I think that trend will continue as investments in AI drive revenue growth and margin expansion . Amazon's artificial intelligence-powered video generator is now available to all U.S. advertisers on the e-commerce platform . The fast rollout of the solution speaks to the mounting arms race between digital advertising platforms when it comes to leveraging generative AI .  The latest version of Amazon’s video generator can create far more sophisticated ads . The technology can emulate realistic motion from virtual models, like a besuited man checking a watch on his wrist for the time . It is also better at stringing multiple scenes together with smoother transitions between animations .  Amazon’s sponsored brand campaign builder can surface six videos in a matter of minutes . Advertisers can upload existing media from their library, such as social content or product demos . Editing tools allow for fine-tuning logo placements, fonts and headlines while ensuring the end result matches brand-specific guidelines .  Amazon's video generator has been a “game-changer” for its clients, says ad agency BTR Media . Half of the products that were promoted with video generator had not been advertised before . Amazon is onboarding more brands into its retail media ecosystem .  Amazon says sponsored brand campaigns featuring video see a 30% higher click-through rate . Amazon’s revenue derived from ad sales increased 19% year over year to $13.92 billion in Q1 .  Amazon will continue to ramp up its investments and innovation bets in generative AI . Richman: "All I can say is watch this space. Watch this space"

Amazon, Celsius, and Roku have long-term potential that investors should consider . Studies have shown that a stock's valuation is one of the biggest factors for price movements over the short term .  Amazon generated $93 billion in revenue in a single quarter (2025's Q1) The scale of its e-commerce business is absolutely massive . I'm still impressed with Amazon's ability to become more efficient and consequently more profitable . Amazon is even testing humanoid robots to aid delivery drivers .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a cloud computing business . As of Q1, AWS was a $117 billion run-rate business, growing at a 17% pace . As artificial intelligence (AI) grows in popularity, cloud computing is more important than ever, giving Amazon stock plenty of long-term upside .  Celsius is a cash-rich, debt-free, profitable business . It recently acquired fast-growing competitor Alani Nu . It's taking greater control of its business by becoming vertically integrated . And third, it's developing a portfolio of new products, including hydration .  Amazon stock and Celsius stock are pretty close to no-brainer opportunities for long-term investors today . I don't necessarily believe that about Roku(NASDAQ: ROKU)stock right now . Roku is closing in on being used in 100 million households .  Roku stock is trading down about 25% over the last five years, but it's not due to a lack of growth . The company has diluted shareholders with its generous use of stock-based compensation for its employees . Even with its own struggles, Roku's business appears to be aptly positioned for huge ongoing shifts in advertising strategies and spending .  Whether Roku stock is a brilliant buy today is up for debate . I believe that Amazon stock and Celsius stock are much safer . But the better thing for investors to remember here is that thinking long-term, as opposed to short-term is always the more brilliant investing approach . AI-driven large language models gobble information in a race to dominate the web’s frontier . The latest of the AI scraping wars is between Reddit and AI startupAnthropic . Reddit claims that Anthropic intentionally scraped Reddit users' personal data without their consent .  Anthropic is also defending itself against a separate suit from music publishers . The case adds to a growing number of high-profile cases where copyright holders have tried to guard their works from the reach of technology firms .  The court rejected Ross's argument that it could use the summaries under the concept offair use, which allows copyrights to be used for news reporting, teaching, research, criticism, and commentary . The New York Times (NYT) filed a lawsuit accusing OpenAI and Microsoft of illegally using millions of published stories to train OpenAI’s language models .  Getty Images is trying to chip away at the same argument in lawsuits filed in 2023 against AI image generation startup Stability . Stability argues that fair use justified training its technology on copyrighted material .  In 2005, the Authors Guild sued Google over millions of books that the tech giant scanned and made available in “snippets” to online searchers . Google didn’t pay for the copyrighted information but did provide word-for-word pieces of the copyrighted works in search results . The US Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit reasoned in adecision that Google’s scanning project tested the limits of fair use but was “transformative” and therefore protected under fair use law .  Google could be drawn into the new AI scraping wars as part of a landmark antitrust case against Google’s Search monopoly that was won last year by the US Justice Department . The DOJ has argued that the search giant could further entrench its dominance by training its AI model, Gemini, on its vast index of internet content .

Apple is one of Warren Buffett's favorite companies . It's the largest position in the Berkshire Hathaway portfolio, accounting for 21.6% of the total . Amazon's AI business presents massive opportunties, and the company's stock is trading at an attractive price .  Many investors know that Buffett loves an undervalued stock . But when explaining how he chooses stocks, he calls himself a business picker, not a stock picker . Buffett: "I didn't go into Apple because it was a tech stock in the least"  Buffett first bought shares of Apple stock in 2016 and built up his position for a few years before selling about half of it last year . When he first bought it, Buffett said that he owned about 5% of shares outstanding but expected that to increase to about 6% to 7% through Apple's share-buyback program .  Amazon's AI business and ambitions are completely different than Apple's . Amazon's greatest AI opportunities are in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud computing segment . Amazon is already seeing massive benefits from investing in AI .  Amazon is the largest e-commerce company in the country, with a strong moat around its leading consumer-goods business . Amazon is heavily investing in the building blocks for developers to create game-changing AI-enabled apps . Amazon's valuation is near its 10-year low .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . Amazon looks like the better buy right now .  American Express is an advertising partner of Motley Fool Money . Berkshire Hathaway is also a member of The Motley Motives' board of directors .

Use of robotics for deliveries by retailers like Amazon could drive over $7.1 billion in annual savings by 2032, analysts say . The analysis comes on the heels of a report from The Information, a tech news publication, saying Amazon is developing artificial intelligence-enabled software for humanoid robots .  Amazon has built up its robotics fleet to include over 20 robot types and more than 750,000 units . Consumer acceptance of robot delivery would likely take time as well, BofA research note says . Amazon last month unveiled its electric Rivian vans to deliver packages directly to customers' doorsteps .  Amazon is testing a two-legged robot dubbed Digit for use in its warehouse operations . The robot was developed by Agility Robotics, one of the companies Amazon invested in through its $1 billion Industrial Innovation Fund . The effort is largely focused on eliminating or reducing manual tasks .

Amazon is set to pour $20 billion into Pennsylvania for new AWS data-center campuses . The first two innovation hubs will rise in Luzerne and Bucks countiesSalem and Falls townships . Since 2010, Amazon has plowed more than $26 billion in Pennsylvania infrastructure and payroll .  Amazon and Talen must address concerns that shifting power to data centers could disadvantage other consumers and skirt grid-use fees . Amazon didn't immediately comment on FERC's review .

The world's largest technology companies are driving ongoing growth trends, including e-commerce, digital advertising, and cloud computing . These same companies could also benefit from upcoming opportunities inartificial intelligence (AI) Investing $100,000 into each of these"Magnificent Seven" stocksasas  E-commerce is Amazon's core business, but the company is just as much a technology company as any . It operates the world's leading cloud platform, Amazon Web Services, which holds an estimated 30% share of the global cloud infrastructure market . AI applications are already driving significant growth for cloud capacity .  Amazon's valuation, a PEG ratio of 2, is reasonable for its estimated 17% long-term earnings growth . If so, cloud tailwinds from AI should boost Amazon's most profitable business and could more than double earnings over the next decade .  Alphabet's anticipated double-digit growth and depressed valuation make it a candidate for substantial returns over the next decade . Meta Platforms is the parent company of social media apps such as Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Threads .  Meta Platforms has rallied and is up significantly over the past few years . The stock's PEG ratio (1.5) remains attractive for prospective investors . The estimated long-term earnings growth rate of 18% suggests there is enough upside for the stock to double or more .
